events.name: Chief Data Officer Summit - Day 2
events.description: Chief Data Officer Summit 2017, a 2 day event hosted by The Innovation Enterprise Ltd. You must register with the event to book your seat. Description: "Manage Data and Lead the Change for Future Competitiveness" More information: https://theinnovationenterprise.com/summits/cdo-singapore-2017 Agenda: Wednesday, July 5 08:00 - Registration & Light Breakfast 08:50 - Chairperson Overview 09:00 - The Digital Transformation Journey 09:30 - When Quality Data Becomes a Differentiator to Achieve Ambition 10:00 - Data Democracy: The Distributed Sandbox Model 10:30 - Coffee Break 11:00 - Data Governance Rollout – Successful Strategies Across People, Process and Technology 11:30 - Why Data? - Before How and What  12:00 - Continuous Reporting in Data Science - Agile Projects and Teams Management 12:30 - Lunch 14:00 - Data Science for E-commerce 14:30 - How the Health and Nutrition Industry is Leveraging Big Data in its R&D 15:00 - Coffee Break 15:30Panel Discussion - Data For Enterprise: Technology and Outlook 16:30 - End of the Summit  ****You must register with the event to book your seat**** Register here: https://theinnovationenterprise.com/summits/cdo-singapore-2017/registration For deeper engagement with Apache Apex, download, view past meetup webinars, slides, and docs.  To reduce time to market, look at operable app-templates that you can quickly import and launch.  Examples: HDFS-Sync, Kafka-HDFS, HDFS-Line-Copy, S3-HDFS and HDFS-Kafka. Free DataTorrent Enterprise Edition for qualifying startups. Check it out! Brought to you by DataTorrent, creators of Apache Apex.
events.location: Grand Copthorne Waterfront Hotel, 392 Havelock Road, Singapore 169663
events.group_name: Next Gen Native Hadoop Big Data Apex Users Group, Singapore

events.name: Journey from Windows to Linux
events.description:
Does your Operating System help you be productive? This presentation introduces you to the benefits of using Linux over Windows as a developer, and explains how you ican leverage the Linux operating system to increase productivity.
The workshop in this session will focus specifically on command line/terminal commands and participants are expected to have prior knowledge of the command prompt in Windows and Terminal in Mac.
Participants who want to follow along must download and install Vagrant: https://www.vagrantup.com/docs/installation

AGENDA

Windows vs Linux
Linux Distributions—which one to choose?
Developer Productivity with Linux
The power of the Command Line
Hands-on: Linux Command Line 101


MEET THE PEOPLE



Prasanna Veerapandi
Assistant Lecturer - Institute of Systems Science, NUS
Speaker


REQUIREMENTS


Participants to bring laptop
Download and Install Vagrant: https://www.vagrantup.com/docs/installation/
Participants are expected to have prior knowledge of the command prompt in Windows and Terminal in Mac.

RESERVING A SEAT

Enter the promotional code that accompanies the invitation email sent to you to reserve a seat.
events.location: StackUp Studio, #02-09, 79 Ayer Rajah Crescent, Block 79, Singapore 139955, Singapore null

events.name: Cybersecurity Guest Lectures by Prof Andrew Woodward and Prof Craig Valli
events.description:
Venue: Lecture Theatre 1, PSB Academy Marina Square CampusDate: 5th July 2017
IET PSB Academy On Campus and IET Singapore YPS presents:
Speaker: Professor Andrew WoodwardTitle: Executive Dean, School of ScienceCompany: Edith Cowan UniversityTopic: IPv6, cyber security and the IoT - history repeating?
SynopsisMost cyber security attacks can usually be traced back to poor design or implementation, both in hardware and software. We have seen this over many years across a range of applications in critical infrastructure, communications and more recently in medical devices. This talk will examine some of the attacks and vulnerabilities that have already been observed, look at some of the parallels with other technologies, and discuss the issue of why we keep repeating the same mistakes.
BioAndrew is currently the Dean of the School of Science at Edith Cowan University in Perth, Western Australia, and was previously Head of the School of Computer and Security Science at the same institution. He has been an active teacher and researcher in cyber security for nearly two decades, and has a wealth of experience in network security, computer security, computer forensics, critical infrastructure protection, control systems security, information security and risk management. Andrew has consulted to industry by performing cyber security vulnerability assessments on critical infrastructure installations across Australia, including power, water and gas utilities. Andrew is regularly invited to give public lectures on cyber security topics, and was appointed to the Interpol Global Cybercrime Expert Group in 2015.
Speaker: Professor Craig ValliTitle: Director, ECU Security Research InstituteCompany: Edith Cowan UniversityTopic: Wannacry and other malware. Lessons learned (and not learned).
SynopsisAs well as the recent Wannacry ransomware attack, there are ongoing, daily instances of malware being used by cyber criminals against small, medium and large organisations. There was nothing particularly new about the Wannacry attack, so why did it cause so much disruption, and generate so much publicity? This talk will examine the attack, the attackers, and what we need to do to protect ourselves from such attacks in the future.
BioProfessor Craig Valli has over 30 year’s experience in the ICT Industry and consults to industry and government on cyber security and digital forensics matters. Along with being Director of the Edith Cowan University Security Research Institute, he is a Professor of Digital Forensics, a Fellow of the Australian Computer Society and Director of the Australian Computer Society Centre of Expertise in Security at ECU. He also currently holds the position of research director for the Australian Cyber Security Research Institute. Craig is the current President of the High Tech Crime Investigators Association (Australian Chapter) and a Member of the INTERPOL Cyber Crime Experts Group.
events.location: PSB Academy City Campus, Marina Square, Singapore 039594

events.name: Practical Cats
events.description:
Heard of Cats? It's not the musical nor the animal but it's a functional programming library that's modeled like Scalaz.  In this sharing session, Raymond will share what he learnt by writing systems using Cats and the OSS from Typelevel.org. In addition, he will also share his experience using Eff Monads: what they are, and what you can do with them. 



Presenter(s): Raymond Tay 


Sponsor(s): Thanks to Spencer Ogden for sponsoring our venue, food, and beverages. 


Agenda: 7:00 -- Food & drinks 7:20 -- Meetup group announcements 7:30 -- Venue / event host announcements 7:40 -- Other announcements 7:50 -- Presentation 8:30 -- Q&A
events.location: Spencer Ogden, One Raffles Place Office Tower 2, #34-61 Singapore 048616

events.name: DataJam!
events.description: We're looking to increase our contributions to the social sector here in Singapore, and will be having a monthly meeting for volunteers who want to do more. These will be working sessions which can include:  • DataJams where data is cleaned and prepped for further analysis,  • Clinics for social sector organisations to drop in and ask data-related questions, and • Planning sessions for wider community events.  Please understand that no food will be provided, so do make preparations to grab a bite before you turn up. Also, it would be great if you bring your own water bottle along with your laptop and power cable too. Agenda 6.45 - 7pm: Registration7 - 7.30pm: Data review and task assignment7.30 - 9.30pm: Data cleaning
events.location: National Volunteer & Philanthropy Centre, 6 Eu Tong Sen Street #04-88 The Central Singapore 059817 (above Clarke Quay MRT Station)

events.name: Lets talk about Project Management!
events.description: Lets get together over a drink and share some tips and experience in dealing with challenging projects. This meet up will be conducted in a relaxed atmosphere so chillax! Free snacks will be provided. Bumped into troubles in your projects? Feel free to toss in questions and let the group give some feedback to you. If you have one topic or two that you would like to talk about, dont hesitate to bring them up as well. The meet up will follow the lean coffee structure. Everybody can suggest a topic or two, and then vote on the topic that interest them. One person can vote twice and may use all their votes on one topic. Topics get the most votes will get the spot light and will be selected for the night. Limited seats only 20 available. Please take note that this meet up starts at 8.00 pm unlike all the previous meetups.
events.location: Kazbar , 25 Church Street #01-03 Capital Square 3 Singapore 049482
